title: Transitions
description: Nuxt leverages Vue's Transition component to apply transitions between pages and layouts.

children.value: component to apply transitions between pages and layouts.
You can enable page transitions to apply an automatic transition for all your
If you are changing layouts as well as page, the page transition you set here will not run. Instead, you should set a layout transition.
To start adding transition between your pages, add the following CSS to your

props.code:
<template>
  <NuxtPage />
</template>

<style>
.page-enter-active,
.page-leave-active {
  transition: all 0.4s;
}
.page-enter-from,
.page-leave-to {
  opacity: 0;
  filter: blur(1rem);
}
</style>

To set a different transition for a page, set the

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
definePageMeta({
  pageTransition: {
    name: 'rotate'
  }
})
</script>

<template>
  <NuxtPage />
</template>

<style>
/* ... */
.rotate-enter-active,
.rotate-leave-active {
  transition: all 0.4s;
}
.rotate-enter-from,
.rotate-leave-to {
  opacity: 0;
  transform: rotate3d(1, 1, 1, 15deg);
}
</style>

You can enable layout transitions to apply an automatic transition for all your
To start adding transition between your pages and layouts, add the following CSS to your

props.code:
<template>
  <NuxtLayout>
    <NuxtPage />
  </NuxtLayout>
</template>

<style>
.layout-enter-active,
.layout-leave-active {
  transition: all 0.4s;
}
.layout-enter-from,
.layout-leave-to {
  filter: grayscale(1);
}
</style>

    name: 'slide-in'
  }
})
</script>

children.value: For advanced use-cases, you can use JavaScript hooks to create highly dynamic and custom transitions for your Nuxt pages.
This way presents perfect use-cases for JavaScript animation libraries such as

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
definePageMeta({
  pageTransition: {
    name: 'custom-flip',
    mode: 'out-in',
    onBeforeEnter: (el) => {
      console.log('Before enter...')
    },
    onEnter: (el, done) => {},
    onAfterEnter: (el) => {}
  }
})
</script>
